SENT.plain: Achondroplasia often accompanies stenosis of both the foramen magnum and the upper cervical spinal canal
Most infants die as a result of respiratory disturbance, including upper airway obstruction, chest deformity, and compression of the cervicomedullary junction
Especially, young patients under 4 years old sometimes suffered sudden death
Therefore, we think it is necessary to perform preventive surgery when the patient's cervicomedullary junction is compressed markedly even if the symptom is mild
She has experienced mild respiratory disturbance since she was born
MRI showed the foramen magnum was narrowed and there was high signal intensity in her cervicomedullary junction
After the surgery, her respiratory function improved and MRI disclosed her foramen magnum was well decompressed
